xtiny-doc-page.name: File Menu
xtiny-doc-page.title: Jext : File Menu
xtiny-doc-page.paragraph: The File menu contains features related to file management (open, save, new, etc.).

menu.title: Contents
menu.item: Creates a new empty file with the current syntax colorizing mode enabled.
Creates a new file from a selected template. You can set the templates directory in the options.
Clears all text from the selected document.
Erases the current file from your hard disk. You'll be prompted before deletion.

Opens an existing file enabling the most appropriate syntax colorizing mode. If you open a ZIP or JAR file, Jext will open a ZipExplorer in which will prompt you to choose which packed file to open from the archive.
Works exactly like the Open function but does not create a new document in the interface. It replaces the selected document instead.
Opens a file specified by its URL. This allows you to open a file from the Web or from your Intranet.
This submenu contains a list of recently opened files. By default it holds the eight most recently opened files, but this can be configured in the Options pane.

Flushes the contents of the Recents submenu. Use it to mask what you've been working on or to prevent accidental access to recent files that no longer exist or aren't currently mounted (i.e. if they were opened from a removable device such as a CD-ROM or floppy disk).
Closes the selected document. If this document was modified, Jext warns you and offers an opportunity to save the document.
Closes all the open documents, asking to save any of them if they were modified.
Saves the current document. If the current document is new (i.e. has not been opened from an existing file or has not been saved yet) Jext calls "Save As..."
Attempts to save all the opened documents.
Permits the current document to be saved with a different name.

Creates a new Jext window and opens an existing file in it, enabling the most appropriate syntax colorizing mode. Opening a ZIP or a JAR file initiates the same action as with the normal Open command.
Closes the current window and exits Jext if there are no remaining windows. If your work hasn't been saved yet, Jext asks you if you would like to save your changes before exiting.
Exits Jext by closing all its open windows and checking if your documents need to be saved or not.
